factiva_sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=AKIPEN0020110407e7470002t&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=BBCCA00020110407e7470015p&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=AKIPEN0020121213e8cd0018h&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=AKIPEN0020121225e8cp0002t&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks
GEO_notes: Jalal-Abad Region is coded in this row.Ethnic violence erupted in the South of Kyrgyzstan in June 2010. The two regions affected were Osh and Jalal-Abad, which were coded on QGIS.
name: Kyrgyzstan

title: China provides 9.3mil som worth of emergency construction materials to Kyrgyzstan for emergency relief
description: Summary: On October 7, 2014 the Ministry of Emergency Situations received building materials in the amount of 9.3mil som($171.1thousand). The building materials were received through the Chinese grant in the framework of the agreement on economic and technical cooperation between the Government of Kyrgyzstan and the Government of China signed on 13 September, 2005. The Ministry of Emergency Situations was instructed to use the materials while carrying out emergency repair works and other emergency operations in the areas and settlements.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=CEASEN0020141016eaag0008h&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks
GEO_notes: While the Ministry of Emergency Situations received the aid, it was explicitly stated that it was to be used in part of Kyrgzstan that needed help. Those areas were not listed due to this being for both current and future emergencies, so it was coded up to country level.
name: Kyrgyzstan

title: CDB provides $900,000 credit line facility to RSK Bank OJSC for on-lending to SMEs, trade, and infrastructure (Linked to Project ID#70924, #70938, #70946, #70934, and #70929)
description: On August 13, 2007, China Development Bank (CDB) signed a $900,000 credit line facility with RSK Bank OJSC. This loan was intended to be used for various on-lending activities, including the development of small and medium size enterprises, trade and commerce between Chinese and Kyrgyz entrepreneurs, and the construction and rehabilitation of infrastructure in the Southern cities and regions of the Kyrgyz Republic. The loan carried the following terms: a maturity period of 7 years and 7 months (the exact maturity date was April 20, 2015) and an interest rate of 6 month LIBOR + 1.5% margin. By December 31, 2013, $900,000 had been drawn down from the credit line (see pg.40-41 of 'RSK Bank OJSC Financial Statements for the year ended 31 December 2013'). This project is linked with a $8 million credit line facility from CDB signed on June 7, 2012 (see linked project ID#70924), a RMB 1,754,041 credit line facility from CDB also signed on June 7, 2012 (see linked project ID#70946), a RMB 2,255,000 credit line facility from CDB signed on January 21, 2011 (see linked project ID#70938), a $3.1 million credit line facility also signed on January 21, 2011 (see linked project ID#70929), and a $2.5 million credit line facility from CDB signed on August 28, 2008 (see linked project ID#70934). STAFF_NOTE: The 6 month LIBOR in 2007 5.376%. Therefore, the interest rate was coded as 5.376% + 1.5%, or 6.876%. The project status was coded as 'Implementation' because $900,000 had been drawn down. For precision, the maturity period was based on the number of days between the signing date and the maturity date (2,807) divided by 365, or 7.7 years approximately.
sources: http://www.rsk.kg/en/about, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.rsk.kg/uploads/files/ru/2b1b09026fedbbef491a6a6f5dbb0122f7f6db72.pdf, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://www.dropbox.com/s/a93lcmkjiuhwnk3/2b1b09026fedbbef491a6a6f5dbb0122f7f6db72.pdf?dl=0, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source
GEO_notes: China gave money to RSK Bank so that it could support small businesses and other enterprises in the south of Kyrgyzstan (PDF page 40). However, the south of Kyrgyzstan was not defined so it was coded up to country level.
name: Kyrgyzstan

title: China provided 267 YTO tractors to Kyrgyzstan
description: On July 29, 2011, the handover ceremony of 267 YTO tractors from China to Kyrgyzstan was held in the square in front of the Kyrgyz government building.
sources: https://3g.163.com/news/article/7A56NCN500014JB5.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/web/gjhdq_676201/gj_676203/yz_676205/1206_676548/1206x2_676568/t843959.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
GEO_notes: China donated 267 tractors to Kyrgyzstan. Kyrgyzstan has said that this will help increase their agricultural production. There was no more information on where the tractors were sent to so I coded up to country_level.
name: Kyrgyzstan
